newsitem.title: PERU: Peru's Yanacocha Jan-Sep gold output up 56 pct.
newsitem.headline: Peru's Yanacocha Jan-Sep gold output up 56 pct.

text.p: Peru's largest gold mine, Minera Yanacocha S.A., produced 18.87 tonnes in the first nine months of the year, up 56 percent compared with the same period last year, the government said Wednesday.

Yanacocha, a joint venture in the northern Peruvian Andes run by Newmont Mining Co, produced 17 tonnes of gold in 1995, up 75 percent from the previous year, and plans this year to boost output to 22 tonnes.
Yanacocha accounted for 38 percent pf Peru's total output in the fist nine months of the year according to preliminary Energy and Mines Ministry figures.
Peru's gold output of 49.22 tonnes in the first nine months was up 17.4 percent compared with the same period last year.
This total output includes an estimated 18.36 tonnes produced by informal gold miners, mainly in Peru's southeastern jungle, southern coast and northeastern Andes.
In 1995, Peru's total gold output rose 18 percent to 56 tonnes.

Yanacocha is owned by partners Newmont and local firm Cia. Minera Buenaventura S.A., which own 51.35 percent and 43.65 percent respectively. The remaining five percent is owned by the World Bank's International Finance Corp.
The firm produces gold through heap-leaching operations at its open-pit mines in highland Cajamarca department some 375 miles (600 km) north of Lima.
